task.title: Viewing endpoint level statistics by using the
task.shortdesc: Use the endpoint monitor to view live, aggregated endpoint data, and to query the best and worst performing connections across several connection metrics.

context.p: You can view endpoint monitoring statistics by using the , by using a , or by using an external monitoring application. For more information about using a to view endpoint monitor statistics, see . For more information about using an external application to view endpoint monitor statistics, see Viewing endpoint level statistics by using an external application. For more information about the predefined queries that you can run, see Endpoint monitoring.

step.cmd: From the , navigate to the Endpoints page by selecting MonitoringEndpoints .

choices.choice:
To view time-series charts for a particular endpoint, metric, and time duration, complete the following steps:
From the Endpoints page, go to the Endpoint Chart pane.
In Source, select the name of the endpoint that you want to monitor.
In Show, select a predefined query that you want to filter on.
In Duration, select the period that you want to monitor.
Click Refresh to generate the output in the endpoint monitor table.

To view statistics for a particular endpoint and metric, complete the following steps:
Go to the Endpoint Data pane. Endpoints are displayed in the Endpoint data table. Up to 10 records can be displayed in the table.
In Query, select the predefined query that you want to filter on.
Enter a value into Filter, and click Apply Filter to view a subset of endpoint data.
Click Refresh to generate the output in the endpoint monitor table.

result.p: The endpoint monitor table is updated to display the results of the query and any filter that is applied to those results.
